data: {"page":1,"results":[{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[28,18],"id":395437,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Sink Hole","overview":"After a massive sinkhole swallows a nearby town, a school bus filled with students is dropped deep underground. After the crash, the students realize the bus is hanging precariously against the side of the sinkhole, held in place by a broken pipe. Any sudden move could send the bus plummeting into the darkness below. Alone and with all the adults injured, the teens struggle for survival with the story taking on shades of Lord of the Flies. Their only hope is a small-town paramedic, who must overcome a tragic past to rescue the students.","popularity":3.787,"poster_path":"/lBrY7yokXZpbxTnqlBe4td5h3bj.jpg","release_date":"2013-04-01","title":"Sink Hole","video":false,"vote_average":5.3,"vote_count":15},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99,10751,36],"id":395467,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Joseph Fielding Smith: The Modern Prophets","overview":"Born the son of a prophet in 1876, Joseph Fielding Smith's life spanned one of the most dynamic times in the history of the world. While his devoted father and mother were exiled to Hawaii, seven-year-old Joseph was left alone for several years to mature. A historian for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints at age 25, Joseph defended the faith as a scholar and prolific writer over the next 70 years. In 1897 he was appointed Assistant Secretary of the Navy. His charge up San Juan Hill during the Spanish-American War in 1898 is re-created.
